June 16 (Reuters) - A Pittsburgh police officer was under investigation 
after video surfaced of him apparently punching a woman during an arrest at 
the weekend gay pride march, Mayor William Peduto said Monday.

Moments into the shaky 15-second video clip that was shared widely on 
social media, Souroth Chatterji, a male police officer, can be seen 
dragging Ariel Lawther, 19, who attended the march, down by the hair and 
punching her in her torso.

Lawther was arrested and charged with aggravated assault, resisting arrest 
and disorderly conduct. A criminal complaint said Lawther had been in an 
altercation with an anti-gay protester, and then began hitting the officer 
as he tried to break up the fight, according to the Pittsburgh 
Tribune-Review.

"I just want to reassure the people that this is a new day, we won't look 
the other way when incidents like this happen," Peduto said at a press 
conference on Monday.

He said that the officer would be on desk duty for 30 days while the 
incident was investigated by the city's Office of Municipal Investigations.

"And we want to assure everybody, and that includes both the public and the 
police, that we want fairness," the mayor said.

Delta Foundation, a gay rights group that organized the march, said in a 
statement that it welcomed the mayor's investigation and said that Lawther 
had been released from jail on bail. Lawther could not be reached for 
comment and it was not immediately clear if she had a lawyer.

Sonya Toler, a spokeswoman for the Pittsburgh police department, said the 
city was "investigating the use of force" in Lawther's arrest, but said the 
investigation prevented her from commenting further. (Reporting by Jonathan 
Allen in New York; Editing by Barbara Goldberg and Grant McCool)﻿

Tired of hearing "its a choice, you are never born gay." WELL lets look at 
the reasoning. I grew up in a Baptist household, introduced to nothing but 
the bible, church, and Christian fellowship. I learned that we are born 
sinners, it is our nature to sin, and it is impossible to be sinless. If we 
were born sinners and gay is a sin, then why cant we be gay? Some churches 
claim that the bible is against gays, some claim otherwise... BUT i am a 
Christian without religion. I read my bible, pray, and spread the good 
word. I am not religious, i aim to be godly. I am a daughter of Christ, and 
my father in Heaven wants us to love our neighbor. He does not want us to 
shun or cast out anyone just because we dont agree with their lives. Be a 
friend! And if you really have a problem with gay people, dont physically 
or verbally abuse us at a pride parade where we are "ALLOWED" to be gay... 
Pray for us instead, and if God really didnt like who we were, he has the 
power to change us, but oh look, i still have a girlfriend. Think what you 
will, say whatever you want... But no matter what you believe, its common 
sense. If you dont want someone like me to walk into your church and talk 
about how being gay is great, then you have no right to be at pride talking 
about how we are sinning. We are all the same, shitty sinners and they even 
teach us that in church. Religion is a life practice, not your ticket to
